Movies like "Sardar Udham" come every once in a generation. This is by no means an easy movie to watch, but it is immensely well made and acted. The story is well written and every scene serves a purpose. The movie wastes no time with genre tropes and gives pertinent information in the right way. Usually, when stories are told out of order, I don't always like the choice, but in this movie, it works perfectly. Most of the movie plays out like an espionage thriller with lots of intrigue surrounding the main character.  That portion of the film is a reminder that slow-paced is not the same thing as boring because I was gripped and interested throughout. While all of that is still excellent, it is in the last hour of the film that I truly will not forget anytime soon. The film goes the distance by depicting brutal but realistic violence in this last act and it is extremely difficult to watch. It isn't necessarily a film I would recommend people watch for entertainment, but it is one of the most powerful movies of 2021 and made a true impact on me. I hope this movie gets the attention it deserves, it is a brilliant work made with care and intense levels of authenticity. All in all, anyone who believes in the power of cinema cannot miss this one.
